Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the actions of the government by stating that they will spray medicine in the air after 10 PM to kill COVID-19.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide any evidence or official sources to support the idea that the government is planning to spray medicine in the air.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that spraying medicine in the air would be an effective method to kill COVID-19, without providing any scientific evidence or expert opinion to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert verdict provides alternative explanations by stating that the government has debunked the rumor and clarified that no such action has been planned.
